entry.title: Happy Anniversary
entry.content: I’d like to wish my beautiful wife a Happy Anniversary today � you’ve already given me three great years and a gorgeous daughter, so when I win the lottery I might just be able to repay you.

entry.title: See no evil, hear no evil�
entry.content:
Tim: Isn’t it typical, your TV breaking just before Christmas.
Rich: Eh?
Tim: You know, watching the portable TV from the bedroom.
Rich: That is my TV.

After suffering years of ridicule from Tim about my lounge TV I’ve celebrated with the purchase of a new one � a 32” LCD Samsung LE32R74. It’s beautifully designed, 1080i HD Ready with integrated Freeview and has fantastic picture quality. Eye strain is now a thing of the past, so now all I’ve got to do is get a new car and Tim might give me some peace�

entry.title: Power to the People
entry.content: I’ve owned a hot hatch (Civic Type R). I sold it just before our daughter was born when I had a major attack of the ‘Mr. Sensible Shoes’, and chopped it in for a 5 door diesel, which in hindsight wasn’t as smart as it might sound. The Type R took us, fully loaded, to the South Coast and back quietly and rapidly; to IKEA to collect flat packed wardrobes; to the refuse-site when I ripped out my old kitchen; to restaurants and pubs on Summer evenings, never out-gunned by Boxters and BMWs, and on some of the best drives I’ve ever had. For me, the hot-hatch is the everyday super-car, bringing performance and practicality to the masses. If I was in the market for another all-round super hero, it would be the Focus ST � quick, spacious, capable and with a bullet proof 5 cylinder engine courtesy of Volvo, it ticks all the boxes. I wonder if they come with baby-sick resistant seats�
